required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Sensory Processing and Motor Development
clinical_study.official_title: The Investigation of Relationship Between Sensory Processing and Motor Development in Preterm Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to analyse correlation between the sensory processing and motor development in preterm infants.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to analyse correlation between the sensory processing and motor development in preterm infants. A total of 60 infants who were born preterm (n=30) and term (n=30), the corrected and chronological ages between 10-12 months, were included in this study. Test of Sensory Function in Infants was used to evaluate sensory processing, and Alberta Infant Motor Scale was used to evaluate motor development.Spearman correlation test indicated strong positive relation between sensory processing and motor development in preterm infants. Given the relationship between sensory processing and motor development in preterm group, for effective implementation of physiotherapy assessments and interventions, it was thought that it is necessary to evaluate the sensory processing as well as the motor development in preterm infants.

primary_outcome.measure: The investigation of sensory processing in preterm infants
primary_outcome.description: Test of Sensory Function in Infants' was used to evaluate sensory processing in preterm infants.

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigation of motor development in preterm infants
secondary_outcome.description: Alberta Infant Motor Scale' was used to evaluate motor development in preterm infants.

arm_group.description: infants who born before 37 completed weeks

study_pop.textblock: A total of 60 infants who were born preterm (n=30) and term (n=30), the corrected and chronological ages between 10-12 months, were included in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- gestational age lower than 37 month
- corrected age within 10-12 months
- without congenital anomaly or systemic disease
- stay in Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) at least 2 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- taken physiotherapy or sensory integration therapy in any rehabilitation center
- having newborn retinopathy
